page.title: 16BESIDE THE DEBEN AT SUTTON
page.content: The distinction between bridlepaths and footpaths is important to the cyclist but a sandy farm track gives no indication of what it is. {On Sunday, the 2nd June 1985, our {ignorance was soon to be put right by {Sir Anthony Quilter's head gamekeeper. {But he soon became most helpful when {he learned that we were on the {Domesday Survey and that we were from {Woodbridge School. His son had recent- {ly left our school, to go to an {agricultural college. We cycled on in brilliant hot sunshine down a track towards the River Deben. It was low tide, but the edge of the estuary was still very marshy as the promised riverside track disappeared into the undergrowth. Our progress slowed as we carried our bicycles along the marshy river margin.
